messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] re: audio
messages.msgSnippet: I think the Deaf Unschooling Revolution of the 21st Century could make the Deaf Power Revolution of the 20th Century seem measly by comparison!! :D And I wanna
messages.messageBody:
I think the Deaf Unschooling Revolution of the 21st Century could make the
Deaf Power Revolution of the 20th Century seem measly by comparison!! :D
And I wanna be on the front edge of THAT!!!
~diana :)
xoxoxoxo
hannahbearski.blogspot.com
hannahsashes.blogspot.com
dianas365.blogspot.com

>

> already exists in text. It's good to have concise summaries of

> The deaf/signing community doesn't even have unschooling on its
> radar, I think.

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] re: audio
messages.msgSnippet: Awesome!   Thanks, Diana! As part of that production I don t mind doing ASL translations of what already exists in text.  It s good to have concise summaries
messages.messageBody:
Awesome! Thanks, Diana!

As part of that production I don't mind doing ASL translations of what
already exists in text. It's good to have concise summaries of
introductory concepts ready so the material won't be too overwhelming.
The deaf/signing community doesn't even have unschooling on its
radar, I think.

Adrean
(who hopes to get CDI certification sometime soon)

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] re: audio
messages.msgSnippet: I think Hayden JUST figgered out how!!! We can make movies from our little camera on the laptop... So, I could be listening and terp it for ya! The quality
messages.messageBody:
I think Hayden JUST figgered out how!!!
We can make movies from our little camera on the laptop... So, I could be
listening and 'terp it for ya!
The quality will be less than ideal but it'll be available. And that talk
is easy, it's my FAVORITE!!
That is going on Next Week's list - Life Is Good Conference this weekend ;)


I have this dream of converting all the available audio to ASL for Adrean,
her family, and the countless others like them!
I wanna do big, beautiful productions, worthy of the information *and* the
mere idea of this project overwhelms me! Where to begin? Who's got Cash?
Lee Stranahan, I need your help!! :D
~diana :)
xoxoxoxo
hannahbearski.blogspot.com
hannahsashes.blogspot.com
dianas365.blogspot.com

messages.messageBody:
I asked because I'm deaf. Sorry, should have made that clear in my
original post. A transcript would be wonderful... plus searchable for
the signing-impaired. ;)

Adrean

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] re: audio
messages.msgSnippet: There was a link provided, which I no longer have but could be found on the UB yahoogroup site. I went there, scrolled down to the bottom and clicked the blue
messages.messageBody:
There was a link provided, which I no longer have but could be found on the UB yahoogroup site. I went there, scrolled down to the bottom and clicked the blue link. Then I clicked on the left side of the page where it said listen/download and opened the download to iTunes. There are two sides to the "tape" so you have two dl 2 files.
Good luck!

Elissa, Unschooling Momma to Emily 15, and Max 9. Proud Momma to Zack, 21.
How is it that little children are so intelligent and men so stupid? It must be education that does it.
--Alexandre Dumas

----- Original Message -----
From: "Adrean Clark" <adreanaline@...>
To: unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Tuesday, May 19, 2009 11:25:01 AM GMT -05:00 US/Canada Eastern
Subject: [unschoolingbasics] re: audio








> My regular advice seems to be recycled pieces from Parenting Peacefully. I
> invested 7$ for the cassette many years ago & it's been the best investment
> I've ever made :D Now you can listen for free!!

I really, really want access to the audios people keep bringing up.
Any way that can be possible?

Adrean
